results.title: Short poppies 2
results.brief_description: Short poppies is a competitive film and video festival open to university and college students from around the world. This collection of ten productions has been selected from the second festival which opened at Kinselas night club in Sydney on July 7th 1994. The films were judged by a panel of filmmakers, critics and students and award winning work then toured around Australia to all capital cities. The short films included originate from Canada, Australia, United Kingdom and Germany, the titles of which are: “Rokadeus”, “The stranger”, “Bear in mind, “Memory snares”, “Bete noire”, “Talk show”, “Pet”, “Schlaraffenland”, “Miss Dudevant’s hand”, and “Beatrix and Marvin”.

results.title: Short play showcase: The New tenant
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Yust
results.brief_description: Eugene Ionesco’s play “The New tenant”, is a classic example of Theatre of the Absurd. The play expresses Ionesco’s sense of the ambiguity and incoherence of much of modern life, especially big-city life. Cast includes Paul Schumacher, Eve McVeagh, Carl Byrd, John Crawford.

results.title: Short history = Scurta istorie
results.creator_credit: Studioul Cinematografic Bucuresti and Ion Popescu Gopo
results.brief_description: Using animation techniques presents a complete history of mankind from the birth of the Earth, showing man as a descendant of an ape. Taking with him everywhere a symbolic flower he explores the planet, optimistically considering life under water, and eventually, life on other planets of the cosmos.

results.title: Short Cuts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Stresses the importance of having good posture and of having equipment and materials arranged for maximum efficiency. Demonstrates how to use tab stops, tab bar and decimal tabulator key. Shows the handling of carbon packs, use of the pressure indicator; correct method for making erasures, insertion of missing words and letters, removal of extra words and letters, typing cards, envelopes and labels, drawing vertical and horizontal lines.

results.title: Shores of Gulf St Vincent
results.brief_description: Marine life of the reefs at 80, 60 and 30 foot depths representing submerged shorelines in St. Vincent Gulf, South Australia. Shows the dense population and variety of populations found in these temperate waters.

results.title: Shoppingtown. Livingroom
results.brief_description: Two short films by Australian director, David Caesar. “Shoppingtown” (8 mins, 1987) begins with a blank screen and multiple voices on the soundtrack. Next, we are presented by a series of silent moving image portraits of customers, workers and visitors to a large suburban shopping mall. The portraits reveal the humanity behind the “faceless” mob that move around us in suburban space. With “Living Room” (22mins, 1988), Caesar extends the style of “Shoppingtown” to construct a series of portraits of people framed within their homes. From homeless youth in Kings Cross to first home-owners in the Western suburbs to shopkeepers behind their counters, “Living Room” again humanises the everyday. While the people pose for the camera, written text flashes in between portraits to further give us in insight into their thoughts and lives. By interposing video footage of home construction between the filmed sequences, the film also asks us to interrogate the meaning of “home”, “ownership” and “place”.

results.title: Shopping in Japan: an invitation to quality
results.brief_description: Retail traders in Japan offer a very wide range of quality consumer goods to the people of Japan and vistors to the country. These include goods made in both the traditional manner by craftsmen in home industries and in small vilalge factories, and those made in the new efficient industrial complexes.
